page.title: 07A FARM IN STAINFORTH (1)
page.content: Farming is the major industry in this area. Like most other farms around here, this one is mixed. It is mainly dairy, having about 70 Fresian cows (though the number being milked varies throughout the year). There are also about 200 sheep, 20 hens and 3 working dogs. The farm landscape consists mainly of pasture land and meadowland. In summer, some of the meadowland is mown for silo and the rest for hay. There is some rough land which is grazed by sheep. Most of the farm buildings are nucleated round the farmhouse, except for a couple of hay barns which are in the meadows, but these are used a lot less than they used to be. The buildings in the farm yard consist of a barn, a couple of shippons and a new milking complex which was built only last year.
